overview_of_class: This course examines how radiogenic isotopes are used to trace processes that govern the chemical evolution of the Earth's surface. The scope includes the theory of radioactive decay, nucleosynthesis, geochronology, and the application of radiogenic isotopes to problems in geochemistry, groundwater hydrology, oceanography, ecology, and environmental science.
name: Radiogenic Isotope Geochemistry
title: WCAS EARTH 313-0-01 Radiogenic Isotope Geochemistry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Registration is reserved for EARTH majors & minors and ENVR_SCI majors & minors.
